headline: Fudge
description: Chocolate fudge is easy to make in the microwave with just 3 ingredients and optional add-ins. Perfect for any dessert or holiday food gifting.

video.description: This dense, chocolatey fudge is so easy to make.
video.name: Fudge

name: Fudge
recipeIngredient: 0.25 cup unsalted butter, cut into pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Combine chocolate chips, condensed milk, and butter in large microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on medium heat until chips are melted, 3 to 5 minutes, stirring once or twice during the cooking.
Meanwhile, generously grease an 8-inch square glass baking dish.
Remove chocolate mixture from the microwave and stir in nuts. Pour into the prepared dish.
Refrigerate until fudge is set, about 2 hours.

review.reviewBody: Super easy recipe with pantry items. Everyone loved it! I added some sea salt to the top. I think adding vanilla would send it over the top!
This delicious fudge recipe is the easiest and most dependable fudge I have ever made. I’ve been making candy for 40 years!
Easy as “pie” to make. Not grainy and matches fudge I have bought from Fudge stores.

You just cannot beat the taste of great fudge and this is truly 5 star. I have made it da rk, semi, sweet and white and choosing would be difficult. Just be certain the chips are completely melted to assure they do not set up as little chrunchies. I prefer smooth

I love this and it is gone in no time. I sometimes add mini-marshmallows and walnuts to the basic recipe. Sometimes I add crushed up Oreo cookies. You can change this great basic recipe anyway you want!
So easy !!! Yum
5 stars for the simplicity and the ease of this recipe. It took but a few minutes from microwave to refrigerator. 4 stars for the flavor. Although good, I thought it lacked a bit in flavor.
I did make this fudge recipe. Unfortunately it's all gone and now I have to make more before Christmas. Everyone loved it. It was gone in 3 days.
This was so easy and so good to eat! I added a little vanilla to it and used regular chocolate chips. Delicious and will make again!

- Quick and easy - Perfect texture and taste - Put crushed up candy cane on top (so good just do it) - Took a bit over 3 hours to fully cool (so don’t worry if urs isnt looking perfect immediatly, trust the proccess)

I melted the butter first and then added milk chocolate chips and the sweetened condensed milk. It took less than a minute in the microwave for it to melt. I omitted the nuts since I have children who don’t like them. The texture of this fudge is different from what I usually make but is easy, creamy, smooth, and soft.
Doesn't set properly. I let it cool in the fridge, then the freezer overnight and within moments of taking it out of the freezer, it had started melting. Massive disappointment.

Literally, the easiest fudge ever. Its fast and in a pinch it's a delicious substitute to "old fashioned fudge" that works EVERY time. I always add a sprinkle of flaked sea salt to the top. Doesn't last long around here!
This the easiest recipe ever. And it's so smooth and milky

I made it with white chocolate chips and I added a tsp of vanilla. Melt the butter first and then stir in chocolate and milk. Give it another 30 seconds in the microwave and a good stir and it’s done. I sprinkled chopped candy cane on top.
Definitely not the usual fudge texture. It's ok for a quick pinch. If I made this again I would use milk chocolate instead of semi sweet.
Easiest recipe ever and the best flavored fudge I've ever made in 70 years !!!
Simple, quick and inexpensive. My husband and friends were delighted with my homemade fudge. I added a few pecans to the basic recipe. I will definitely be making it again soon

I use 2 (12 oz.) bags of chips, 1 can sweetened condensed milk, 1/4 c butter and 1 t. Vanilla. Aldi chips work fine. I especially like 1 bag semisweet chips and 1 bag salted caramel chips. I use 9x13 pan but of course a smaller pan would make thicker pieces. A friend who is diabetic said she heard on a TV food show that this could be ok (in moderation) for diabetics.
Loved it, super easy and very versatile.

It was an ok recipe, it certainly was good BUT it didn't turn into fudge, just a chocolate syrup. It was very good on ice cream, but if you are wanting fudge I recommend using a marshmallow fluff recipe.
Great Fudge
Easy peasy! Added a tsp of salt and vanilla each, at the last stirring.
added extra walnuts

This fudge has a distinctly different texture than the old-fashioned fudge you cook to soft-ball stage and then beat, but it's also much faster to make and got an equally or more positive reaction from the people I gave it to. So who am I to complain if my friends and family enjoy the easier option? Some modifications you can try: 1) Toast the walnuts. I'm surprised this wasn't explicitly part of the recipe as it's an easy way to enhance the walnut flavour. You can even do it in the microwave. 2) Make it on the stovetop and brown the butter before adding the chocolate. 3) Add 1 tsp vanilla and 2 tsp espresso powder for a hint of mocha flavour. 4) Sprinkle coarse salt on top after spreading it in the pan. Or do all of these at once! I tried that and it was delicious.

I haven’t eaten it yet, but did anyone have issues with the butter not blending in with the condensed milk and chocolate pieces? It separated and there was no blending them together, no matter how much I stirred. I put it in the 8x8 and dabbed many paper towels to absorb the oily butter on the sides and top. I guessed once it was refrigerated it would be hardened butter. Be interested to see what happens when it sets.🤷‍♀️
Excellent fudge, everyone at work and home loved it. I added 1/2 tsp vanilla and a pinch of sea salt, I omitted the walnuts.

I followed the recipe and then added 1/2 container of Marshmallow cream, which took care of any grainy Ness! It's a good easy fudge recipe, obviously nothing is as good as old fashioned fudge but this satisfied my craving
Brought a batch for my family's Holiday festivities. They loved them!
the fudge didn't work out but it is a great pretzel dip according to my daughter
WONDERFULLY DELICIOUS, so easy to fix.

I followed the recipe but used pecans instead and it was so yummy. My grandkids enjoyed it as well. I plan to share it with friends and other family during holiday gatherings. Thanks for the recipe!! It’s a keeper for sure!!
Easy and delicious!!
Good! I add 1/2 teaspoon vanilla flavoring.
Easy and really good! A quick treat for family!
Needs more of a milk chocolate. Isn't setting up
Love it! Very simple recipe and so delicious!

I remember making fudge like this with my mom. But this was way too semisweet, and I’m a huge fan of dark chocolate. I would definitely try it again with milk chocolate chips like others suggest. Also agree to melt butter before putting it with chocolate. One thing that did work was melting caramel and adding a little cream to swirl it in. If I had had more of that, the semisweet chocolate would have been ok since it’s sweet.

Great recipe. I use it every year Like others I felt it was too dark chocolate for me. I tried half milk chocolate and half semi sweet and it was still too dark for my taste. I used milk chocolate and it turned out great! On these directions and many others it specifically says, "do not use milk chocolate" It's because milk chocolate has less cocoa in it and doesn't set as well as dark or semi sweet chocolate. I'm not a fan of the chalky fudge, traditionally served so this was a perfect consistency. important note. It will taste as good as the chocolate you use. If you chose cheaper chips then, yes it will taste like a bar of cheap sugary chips. Use a premium chocolate. I use Ghirardelli.
looks good
It is not fudge. It is soft chocolate candy. Does not taste like fudge nor have the texture of fudge. Hope I can add sugar water and boil to soft ball to recover a resemblance of fudge.

This fudge was delicious! Unfortunately it did stick to the pan so we did end of having to scoop it up and eat it with a spoon. This recipe was a little on the sweet side. I recommend leaving the fudge in the fridge for quite a while as I left it in for about 3-4 hours and it looked set, but once I cut it up it was quite wet still.

Super easy, tasty, and quick.
I strongly recommend.

So easy to make. I made this for a birthday party just did not use nuts do to nut allergies. About to make a lot more fo my wedding.

This may be obvious to you skilled bakers out there but I was not aware and used a frozen stick which did not go very well.
I have it in the frige right now so i have to eat it still but i think this is a very good recipie because it is so easy

This was the first time in ages I had attempted to make fudge - grand kids asked for it - and with this recipe I will make it for them whenever they want. Only thing I did different was put in pecans - what I had in the cupboard.
Granddaughter made it for Christmas it was very good. I am going to try it again

fudge!

i loved it my mom thought it was a little rich but i snuck about half of it.

It’s ok if you are craving fudge like I was and only have these ingredients! It cures the craving but my other recipe is MUCH better. Wish I had all the ingredients for it.

The fudge came out at the perfect consistency (solid, but still soft). It was creamy, rich, and very easy to make. The only problem was that it didn’t last. I made a batch and it was gone the next day.

Not awful but not worth the effort for mediocre fudge. A couple problems:
- It is so much more complicated making it in the microwave than using a double boiler. DO NOT BURN OR BOIL THE CHIPS , this is easier to prevent on the stove top in a double boiler than in the microwave. 
- it tastes a little too dark for my and most peoples liking. I would recommend using 50% milk chocolate chips, or some kind of flavored chips like butterscotch etc.
- the dir should say to melt the chips and butter first and then add in the s.cond milk (again this is easy on the stove top)
- if you have to use a microwave, use the widest bowl possible. If your bowl is deep but not wide, the middle bunch of chips will never fully melt. 

If you don’t have a proper double boiler, you can put a smaller pot inside of a larger one and it does the trick, ok it’s a bit angled

I would recommend to be careful not to overheat. Recipe came out good. I substituted cannabutter for butter and added 2tsp vanilla.

I had to put in the fridge over night so it would crumble apart when cutting. Then lelet air day to not stick on you hands. Awesome taste! Will make again!

I tried this recipe and for the first time in my life, I was able to successfully make fugde. It was so simple and it turned out AMAZING.
made it yesterday for me and my husband to share. I added walnuts to it. It is already halfway gone! working on the Christmas weight gain

its setting but theremight be too many chocolate chips

My batch came out delicious with small modifications: 

1. Swapped a small portion of the semi sweet chocolate chips for pieces of a milk chocolate bar. I used a scale to make sure I still had the right total weight of chocolate. Ended up being 1lb semi sweet, 4oz milk choc.

2. Instead of microwaving, I did stove top over low heat, stirring constantly. Butter first, then added all the milk, then slowly added the chocolate until everything was well mixed. Then folded in the nuts as normal. After an hour in the fridge it was just firm enough to cut slices, but the texture was more like half-baked brownie batter than fudge. Within 10 minutes in the freezer it was the perfect fudge texture. Maybe it just needed more time in the fridge. We were overeager!
